messages.message:
Look like they’re trying to try generate an excel spreadsheet as the end product:
```
We are actually trying to produce an Excel file from the information we parse. I believe creating json files is rather natural for Instabase. Do you have a recommended method for producing Excel formatted files? Is xlswrite supported?
```

Thanks @Handsome Dave, we’re planning to add to the option to export the ibocr results as CSV / XLS as part of the `Merge File` step.  This option already exists for `Metaflow` and `Multiflow`, so this feature will make all the `Flow Types` on par.
I’ll create a ticket in JIRA around this, @will how do we add the Zendesk ticket information to the JIRA ticket?
:smile:
You can either create the jira and link it with the ZD ticket, or create the jira from ZD directly
Nice, https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INFRA-256 is the ticket that I created
I went ahead an linked it, so it should now show up in both
So cool!  We should add this step to the `Zendesk` integration section :slightly_smiling_face:
Yayy!!
I’ve updated the doc as well. :slightly_smiling_face:

```
Good morning Gary,

Our engineering team is working on having built-in support to output CSV/XLS from the `Merge Files` step in a future release. Currently, the best approach is what you're doing, as long as you're able to wrangle the steps in your flow such that `Merge Files` comes last.

Keep an eye on our release notes for when this added, and if you have any further questions please don't hesitate to ask!

Cheers,

David
```
Is that correct? I.e., he should be able to do what he wants now, as long as he’s generating the CSV himself, but a future release will make it much easier?
@shaunak Does my response look good to you?
Let me look at the video once again :slightly_smiling_face:
They also uploaded their python function that’s creating the CSV into the ticket

```Currently, the best approach is what you're doing, as long as you're able to wrangle the steps in your flow such that `Merge Files` comes last.```

we might want to change this to:
```Currently, the best approach is to have the `Apply UDF` step produce the `CSV` files, and have the `Merge Files` merge the `CSV` files by selecting the `CSV` option from `Input File Type`. 
```

We can also paste the picture if that makes it easier.
Makes sense. The merge files step takes care of headers and everything (in the case of CSV)?
unfortunately the CSV mergeer does not handle headers right now — it will literally merge each list of CSV rows as is and concatenate it into one big CSV file
rows_file1 + rows_file2 + rows_file3 becomes the final output rows in the out.csv
No problem. I’ll make sure to mention that as a thing to watch out for
Thank you!
